gobblin.runtime.mapreduce

Class MRJobLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.runtime.AbstractJobLauncher
      • gobblin.runtime.mapreduce.MRJobLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobLauncher, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class MRJobLauncher
extends AbstractJobLauncher
    An implementation of JobLauncher that launches a Gobblin job as a Hadoop MR job.

    The basic idea of this implementation is to use mappers as containers to run tasks. In the Hadoop MP job, each mapper is responsible for executing one or more tasks. A mapper uses its input to get the paths of the files storing serialized work units, deserializes the work units and creates tasks, and executes the tasks in a thread pool. TaskExecutor and Task remain the same as in local single-node mode. Each mapper writes out task states upon task completion.

      The mapper class that runs assigned WorkUnits.

      • runWorkUnits

        protected void runWorkUnits(List<WorkUnit> workUnits)
                     throws Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractJobLauncher
        Run the given job.

        The contract between AbstractJobLauncher.launchJob(JobListener) and this method is this method is responsible for for setting JobState.RunningState properly and upon returning from this method (either normally or due to exceptions) whatever JobState.RunningState is set in this method is used to determine if the job has finished.

        Specified by:
        runWorkUnits in class AbstractJobLauncher
        Parameters:
        workUnits - List of WorkUnits of the job
        Throws:
        Exception
